    • Method Detail

      • accessService

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> accessService(java.lang.String url,
                                                             ConnectionManagerImpl.RequestMethod requestMethod,
                                                             ConnectionManagerImpl.ContentType contentType,
                                                             AppSession appSession,
                                                             java.lang.String kerberosServiceSessionID,
                                                             UserSession userSession,
                                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> data)
                                                               throws java.io.IOException,
                                                                      RestClientException,
                                                                      ResponseDecryptionException,
                                                                      InvalidResponseAuthenticatorException
        Description copied from interface: IUserAccessServiceClient
        This method provides a secure channel between the App and Service. It requires Kerberos Service Ticket and Application and User Authentication against the Service have been performed
        Specified by:
        accessService in interface IUserAccessServiceClient
        Parameters:
        url - String Web Service URL to be called for the service to be accessed
        requestMethod - RequestMethod Request Method to be used for making the connection
        contentType - ContentType Content Type header to be used in the request
        appSession - AppSession App Session created by the Service being accessed
        kerberosServiceSessionID - String Kerberos Generated Service Session ID from the App and Service
        userSession - UserSession User Session created by the Service being invoked on Authentication
        data - Map Data to be send on the Service Side
        Returns:
        Map Data sent by the Service
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - In case there are some errors encountered while retrieving information
        RestClientException - If the status of the response is not 200. The server side error message and error response code can be accessed using getMessage and getErrorCode methods respectively
        ResponseDecryptionException - If the Response could not be decrypted
        InvalidResponseAuthenticatorException - If the Response Authenticator failed to validate
